intro: Alstonia vitiensis, commonly known as the Vitiensis Tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, including parts of Fiji and Tonga. The plant is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, featuring a straight trunk and a broad, umbrella-like canopy. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are clustered in umbels and are typically white or pale pink. The tree produces woody capsules as fruits, which contain seeds covered in a sticky, fleshy aril.
